Who are we?

The Seventh-day Adventist Church is a global movement of committed Christians following Jesus and eagerly awaiting His soon return. Seventh-day Adventists have their faith centred in Jesus as revealed in the Bible, the ultimate source of truth. We believe God Loves, Creates, Redeems, Inhabits, Transforms and Triumphs in this life and beyond

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]

<!-- wp:divi/text {"module":{"advanced":{"htmlAttributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"class":"","id":""}}}},"decoration":{"background":{"desktop":{"value":{"color":"#ffffff"}}},"spacing":{"desktop":{"value":{"padding":{"top":"40px","right":"40px","bottom":"0px","left":"40px","syncVertical":"off","syncHorizontal":"on"}}}},"border":{"desktop":{"value":{"radius":{"sync":"on","topLeft":"4px","topRight":"4px","bottomRight":"4px","bottomLeft":"4px"},"styles":{"left":{"width":"5px","color":"#ff8200"}}}}},"boxShadow":{"desktop":{"value":{"style":"preset3","color":"rgba(0,0,0,0.07)"}}},"attributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"attributes":[{"id":"e9919706-e7d9-4310-9783-6d80d527f1a7","name":"class","value":"pa-toggle-text","adminLabel":"CSS Class"}]}}},"layout":{"desktop":{"value":{"display":"block"}}}}},"content":{"decoration":{"headingFont":{"h3":{"font":{"desktop":{"value":{"weight":"700","style":["uppercase"],"size":"25px"}},"tablet":{"value":{"size":"25px"}},"phone":{"value":{"size":"18px"}}}}}},"innerContent":{"desktop":{"value":"\u003ch3\u003eWho is God?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGod the eternal Father is the Creator, Source, Sustainer, and Sovereign of all creation. He is just and holy, merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e"}}},"builderVersion":"5.0.0-public-beta.2","themeBuilderArea":{"desktop":{"value":"et_body_layout"}}} /-->

<!-- wp:divi/text {"module":{"advanced":{"htmlAttributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"class":"","id":""}}}},"decoration":{"background":{"desktop":{"value":{"color":"#ffffff"}}},"spacing":{"desktop":{"value":{"padding":{"top":"40px","right":"40px","bottom":"0px","left":"40px","syncVertical":"off","syncHorizontal":"on"}}}},"border":{"desktop":{"value":{"radius":{"sync":"on","topLeft":"4px","topRight":"4px","bottomRight":"4px","bottomLeft":"4px"},"styles":{"left":{"width":"5px","color":"#ff8200"}}}}},"boxShadow":{"desktop":{"value":{"style":"preset3","color":"rgba(0,0,0,0.07)"}}},"attributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"attributes":[{"id":"06a2b315-e0e2-4a18-9f80-87ab70810bf5","name":"class","value":"pa-toggle-text","adminLabel":"CSS Class"}]}}},"layout":{"desktop":{"value":{"display":"block"}}}}},"content":{"decoration":{"headingFont":{"h3":{"font":{"desktop":{"value":{"weight":"700","style":["uppercase"],"size":"25px"}},"tablet":{"value":{"size":"18px"}},"phone":{"value":{"size":"18px"}}}}}},"innerContent":{"desktop":{"value":"\u003ch3\u003eWhen Was Jesus Born?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhile the world celebrates December 25 as the day of Jesus' birth, this may not be historically accurate. While the Bible gives us little detail about the exact time of Jesus' birth, we can deduce a time frame using historical and Biblical evidence that will determine the time Jesus was born.\u003c/p\u003e"}}},"builderVersion":"5.0.0-public-beta.2","themeBuilderArea":{"desktop":{"value":"et_body_layout"}}} /-->

<!-- wp:divi/text {"module":{"advanced":{"htmlAttributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"class":"","id":""}}}},"decoration":{"background":{"desktop":{"value":{"color":"#ffffff"}}},"spacing":{"desktop":{"value":{"padding":{"top":"40px","right":"40px","bottom":"0px","left":"40px","syncVertical":"off","syncHorizontal":"on"}}}},"border":{"desktop":{"value":{"radius":{"sync":"on","topLeft":"4px","topRight":"4px","bottomRight":"4px","bottomLeft":"4px"},"styles":{"left":{"width":"5px","color":"#ff8200"}}}}},"boxShadow":{"desktop":{"value":{"style":"preset3","color":"rgba(0,0,0,0.07)"}}},"attributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"attributes":[{"id":"27f4227d-1962-4d12-8e7c-5d9a9081d881","name":"class","value":"pa-toggle-text","adminLabel":"CSS Class"}]}}},"layout":{"desktop":{"value":{"display":"block"}}}}},"content":{"decoration":{"headingFont":{"h3":{"font":{"desktop":{"value":{"weight":"700","style":["uppercase"],"size":"25px"}},"tablet":{"value":{"size":"18px"}},"phone":{"value":{"size":"18px"}}}}}},"innerContent":{"desktop":{"value":"\u003ch3\u003eWho Wrote the Bible?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Holy Scriptures, Old and New Testaments, are the written Word of God, given by divine inspiration. The inspired authors spoke and wrote as they were moved by the Holy Spirit. In this Word, God has committed to humanity the knowledge necessary for salvation. The Holy Scriptures are the supreme, authoritative, and the infallible revelation of His will.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e"}}},"builderVersion":"5.0.0-public-beta.2","themeBuilderArea":{"desktop":{"value":"et_body_layout"}}} /-->

<!-- wp:divi/text {"module":{"advanced":{"htmlAttributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"class":"","id":""}}}},"decoration":{"background":{"desktop":{"value":{"color":"#ffffff"}}},"spacing":{"desktop":{"value":{"padding":{"top":"40px","right":"40px","bottom":"0px","left":"40px","syncVertical":"off","syncHorizontal":"on"}}}},"border":{"desktop":{"value":{"radius":{"sync":"on","topLeft":"4px","topRight":"4px","bottomRight":"4px","bottomLeft":"4px"},"styles":{"left":{"width":"5px","color":"#ff8200"}}}}},"boxShadow":{"desktop":{"value":{"style":"preset3","color":"rgba(0,0,0,0.07)"}}},"attributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"attributes":[{"id":"618b42a6-3137-4f62-87c5-cd74d6fd6dd3","name":"class","value":"pa-toggle-text","adminLabel":"CSS Class"}]}}},"layout":{"desktop":{"value":{"display":"block"}}}}},"content":{"decoration":{"headingFont":{"h3":{"font":{"desktop":{"value":{"weight":"700","style":["uppercase"],"size":"25px"}},"tablet":{"value":{"size":"18px"}},"phone":{"value":{"size":"18px"}}}}}},"innerContent":{"desktop":{"value":"\u003ch3\u003eWhat Is love?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe Bible refers to love as a personal being - God himself. This means that everything God speaks, thinks, or feels is the revelation of love. When we manifest love towards each other, we are simply being who God created us to be.\u003c/p\u003e"}}},"builderVersion":"5.0.0-public-beta.2","themeBuilderArea":{"desktop":{"value":"et_body_layout"}}} /-->

<!-- wp:divi/text {"module":{"advanced":{"htmlAttributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"class":"","id":""}}}},"decoration":{"background":{"desktop":{"value":{"color":"#ffffff"}}},"spacing":{"desktop":{"value":{"padding":{"top":"40px","right":"40px","bottom":"0px","left":"40px","syncVertical":"off","syncHorizontal":"on"}}}},"border":{"desktop":{"value":{"radius":{"sync":"on","topLeft":"4px","topRight":"4px","bottomRight":"4px","bottomLeft":"4px"},"styles":{"left":{"width":"5px","color":"#ff8200"}}}}},"boxShadow":{"desktop":{"value":{"style":"preset3","color":"rgba(0,0,0,0.07)"}}},"attributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"attributes":[{"id":"1d7799c2-dbc2-4c15-a401-006309703688","name":"class","value":"pa-toggle-text","adminLabel":"CSS Class"}]}}},"layout":{"desktop":{"value":{"display":"block"}}}}},"content":{"decoration":{"headingFont":{"h3":{"font":{"desktop":{"value":{"weight":"700","style":["uppercase"],"size":"25px"}},"tablet":{"value":{"size":"18px"}},"phone":{"value":{"size":"18px"}}}}}},"innerContent":{"desktop":{"value":"\u003ch3\u003eIs Hell Real?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe Bible talks about hell as a fire that leads to complete destruction and death rather than a fire that burns continually throughout eternity. Hell is more of an event than a place. Hell refers to the ultimate destruction of sin in whats described as the \u0022lake of fire\u0022 in Revelation 20. And as sin is destroyed, so it anything or anyone that holds onto it.\u003c/p\u003e"}}},"builderVersion":"5.0.0-public-beta.2","themeBuilderArea":{"desktop":{"value":"et_body_layout"}}} /-->

<!-- wp:divi/text {"module":{"advanced":{"htmlAttributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"class":"","id":""}}}},"decoration":{"background":{"desktop":{"value":{"color":"#ffffff"}}},"spacing":{"desktop":{"value":{"padding":{"top":"40px","right":"40px","bottom":"0px","left":"40px","syncVertical":"off","syncHorizontal":"on"}}}},"border":{"desktop":{"value":{"radius":{"sync":"on","topLeft":"4px","topRight":"4px","bottomRight":"4px","bottomLeft":"4px"},"styles":{"left":{"width":"5px","color":"#ff8200"}}}}},"boxShadow":{"desktop":{"value":{"style":"preset3","color":"rgba(0,0,0,0.07)"}}},"attributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"attributes":[{"id":"952c968c-db06-4176-a3d6-9cb8121574c4","name":"class","value":"pa-toggle-text","adminLabel":"CSS Class"}]}}},"layout":{"desktop":{"value":{"display":"block"}}}}},"content":{"decoration":{"headingFont":{"h3":{"font":{"desktop":{"value":{"weight":"700","style":["uppercase"],"size":"25px"}},"tablet":{"value":{"size":"18px"}},"phone":{"value":{"size":"18px"}}}}}},"innerContent":{"desktop":{"value":"\u003ch3\u003eWhat day is the Sabbath?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe Bible identifies the Sabbath as the seventh day of the week, Saturday, established by God at Creation as a holy day of rest. Observed by Jesus and early Christians, it is a time for worship, renewal, and reflection, offering a rhythm of rest that connects humanity with Gods divine design and provision. To learn more, visit \u0022\u003ca href=\u0022https://www.hopechannel.com/articles/the-bible/the-sabbath/what-day-is-the-sabbath\u0022 target=\u0022_blank\u0022 rel=\u0022noopener\u0022 title=\u0022What day is the Sabbath\u0022\u003eWhat day is the Sabbath?\u003c/a\u003e\u0022\u003c/p\u003e"}}},"builderVersion":"5.0.0-public-beta.2","themeBuilderArea":{"desktop":{"value":"et_body_layout"}}} /-->
<!-- /wp:divi/column -->

<!-- wp:divi/column {"module":{"advanced":{"type":{"desktop":{"value":"1_2"}}},"decoration":{"layout":{"desktop":{"value":{"display":"block"}}}}},"builderVersion":"5.0.0-public-beta.2","themeBuilderArea":{"desktop":{"value":"et_body_layout"}}} -->
<!-- wp:divi/text {"module":{"advanced":{"htmlAttributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"class":"","id":""}}}},"decoration":{"background":{"desktop":{"value":{"color":"#ffffff"}}},"spacing":{"desktop":{"value":{"padding":{"top":"40px","right":"40px","bottom":"0px","left":"40px","syncVertical":"off","syncHorizontal":"on"}}}},"border":{"desktop":{"value":{"radius":{"sync":"on","topLeft":"4px","topRight":"4px","bottomRight":"4px","bottomLeft":"4px"},"styles":{"left":{"width":"5px","color":"#ff8200"}}}}},"boxShadow":{"desktop":{"value":{"style":"preset3","color":"rgba(0,0,0,0.07)"}}},"attributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"attributes":[{"id":"4cee0e87-b123-4e80-a846-c4169ee8ac41","name":"class","value":"pa-toggle-text","adminLabel":"CSS Class"}]}}},"layout":{"desktop":{"value":{"display":"block"}}}}},"content":{"decoration":{"headingFont":{"h3":{"font":{"desktop":{"value":{"weight":"700","style":["uppercase"],"size":"25px"}},"tablet":{"value":{"size":"18px"}},"phone":{"value":{"size":"18px"}}}}}},"innerContent":{"desktop":{"value":"\u003ch3\u003eHow to study the Bible?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIf you've ever felt like studying the Bible is a challenge, and you're just not sure where to start, we've got some simple tips and tricks that you can use to improve your Bible study experience.\u003c/p\u003e"}}},"builderVersion":"5.0.0-public-beta.2","themeBuilderArea":{"desktop":{"value":"et_body_layout"}}} /-->

<!-- wp:divi/text {"module":{"advanced":{"htmlAttributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"class":"","id":""}}}},"decoration":{"background":{"desktop":{"value":{"color":"#ffffff"}}},"spacing":{"desktop":{"value":{"padding":{"top":"40px","right":"40px","bottom":"0px","left":"40px","syncVertical":"off","syncHorizontal":"on"}}}},"border":{"desktop":{"value":{"radius":{"sync":"on","topLeft":"4px","topRight":"4px","bottomRight":"4px","bottomLeft":"4px"},"styles":{"left":{"width":"5px","color":"#ff8200"}}}}},"boxShadow":{"desktop":{"value":{"style":"preset3","color":"rgba(0,0,0,0.07)"}}},"attributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"attributes":[{"id":"25314dab-8380-4376-bb7a-d91bb0b80575","name":"class","value":"pa-toggle-text","adminLabel":"CSS Class"}]}}},"layout":{"desktop":{"value":{"display":"block"}}}}},"content":{"decoration":{"headingFont":{"h3":{"font":{"desktop":{"value":{"weight":"700","style":["uppercase"],"size":"25px"}},"tablet":{"value":{"size":"18px"}},"phone":{"value":{"size":"18px"}}}}}},"innerContent":{"desktop":{"value":"\u003ch3\u003eHow Will The world end?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u0022End times\u0022 refers to the period of time that occurs before the second coming of Jesus, and the end of this sinful world before it is re-created into the new earth. The Bible gives us some clues to help us recongise when these times are near, what we can expect, and what it may mean for our daily lives. The best part is that God doesn't want us to be afraid. He wants us to be informed and prepared, trusting in Him.\u003c/p\u003e"}}},"builderVersion":"5.0.0-public-beta.2","themeBuilderArea":{"desktop":{"value":"et_body_layout"}}} /-->

<!-- wp:divi/text {"module":{"advanced":{"htmlAttributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"class":"","id":""}}}},"decoration":{"background":{"desktop":{"value":{"color":"#ffffff"}}},"spacing":{"desktop":{"value":{"padding":{"top":"40px","right":"40px","bottom":"0px","left":"40px","syncVertical":"off","syncHorizontal":"on"}}}},"border":{"desktop":{"value":{"radius":{"sync":"on","topLeft":"4px","topRight":"4px","bottomRight":"4px","bottomLeft":"4px"},"styles":{"left":{"width":"5px","color":"#ff8200"}}}}},"boxShadow":{"desktop":{"value":{"style":"preset3","color":"rgba(0,0,0,0.07)"}}},"attributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"attributes":[{"id":"85c77336-406c-4c4a-a167-3a6be93b7815","name":"class","value":"pa-toggle-text","adminLabel":"CSS Class"}]}}},"layout":{"desktop":{"value":{"display":"block"}}}}},"content":{"decoration":{"headingFont":{"h3":{"font":{"desktop":{"value":{"weight":"700","style":["uppercase"],"size":"25px"}},"tablet":{"value":{"size":"18px"}},"phone":{"value":{"size":"18px"}}}}}},"innerContent":{"desktop":{"value":"\u003ch3\u003eWhy does God allow suffering?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe Bible tells us that all the evil and suffering in our world is the result fo sin. Sin is rebellion against God's plan by free moral beings. Christianity teaches that God is a God of love. He is also a God of justice and perfect righteousness. To learn more, visit \u0022\u003ca href=\u0022https://www.hopechannel.com/articles/the-bible/good-and-evil/why-does-god-allow-suffering\u0022 target=\u0022_blank\u0022 rel=\u0022noopener\u0022 title=\u0022Why does God allow suffering?\u0022\u003eWhy does God allow suffering?\u003c/a\u003e\u0022\u003c/p\u003e"}}},"builderVersion":"5.0.0-public-beta.2","themeBuilderArea":{"desktop":{"value":"et_body_layout"}}} /-->

<!-- wp:divi/text {"module":{"advanced":{"htmlAttributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"class":"","id":""}}}},"decoration":{"background":{"desktop":{"value":{"color":"#ffffff"}}},"spacing":{"desktop":{"value":{"padding":{"top":"40px","right":"40px","bottom":"0px","left":"40px","syncVertical":"off","syncHorizontal":"on"}}}},"border":{"desktop":{"value":{"radius":{"sync":"on","topLeft":"4px","topRight":"4px","bottomRight":"4px","bottomLeft":"4px"},"styles":{"left":{"width":"5px","color":"#ff8200"}}}}},"boxShadow":{"desktop":{"value":{"style":"preset3","color":"rgba(0,0,0,0.07)"}}},"attributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"attributes":[{"id":"298a8096-0d13-4962-8f4e-11ebaae3592d","name":"class","value":"pa-toggle-text","adminLabel":"CSS Class"}]}}},"layout":{"desktop":{"value":{"display":"block"}}}}},"content":{"decoration":{"headingFont":{"h3":{"font":{"desktop":{"value":{"weight":"700","style":["uppercase"],"size":"25px"}},"tablet":{"value":{"size":"18px"}},"phone":{"value":{"size":"18px"}}}}}},"innerContent":{"desktop":{"value":"\u003ch3\u003eIs there a final Judgement?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe final judgement is associated with the climax of the long controversy between God and Satan, which ends in the complete victory by God. After the final judgement there will be no more sin, instead there will be harmony throughout creation.\u003c/p\u003e"}}},"builderVersion":"5.0.0-public-beta.2","themeBuilderArea":{"desktop":{"value":"et_body_layout"}}} /-->

<!-- wp:divi/text {"module":{"advanced":{"htmlAttributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"class":"","id":""}}}},"decoration":{"background":{"desktop":{"value":{"color":"#ffffff"}}},"spacing":{"desktop":{"value":{"padding":{"top":"40px","right":"40px","bottom":"0px","left":"40px","syncVertical":"off","syncHorizontal":"on"}}}},"border":{"desktop":{"value":{"radius":{"sync":"on","topLeft":"4px","topRight":"4px","bottomRight":"4px","bottomLeft":"4px"},"styles":{"left":{"width":"5px","color":"#ff8200"}}}}},"boxShadow":{"desktop":{"value":{"style":"preset3","color":"rgba(0,0,0,0.07)"}}},"attributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"attributes":[{"id":"9c493547-c414-463b-8bca-75d87013ff22","name":"class","value":"pa-toggle-text","adminLabel":"CSS Class"}]}}},"layout":{"desktop":{"value":{"display":"block"}}}}},"content":{"decoration":{"headingFont":{"h3":{"font":{"desktop":{"value":{"weight":"700","style":["uppercase"],"size":"25px"}},"tablet":{"value":{"size":"18px"}},"phone":{"value":{"size":"18px"}}}}}},"innerContent":{"desktop":{"value":"\u003ch3\u003eIs the Bible Accurate?\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe Bible is not just a collection of human opinions, it is the word of God spoken through human beings. It provides us with practical advice on how we should live and reveals the lifestyle that God knows is best for us. There are non-bilbical sources that confirm the truth of scripture, and prophecy fulfilled. Further evidence comes from human experience, to see the effects of the Bible's message in the lives of others.\u003c/p\u003e"}}},"builderVersion":"5.0.0-public-beta.2","themeBuilderArea":{"desktop":{"value":"et_body_layout"}}} /-->

<!-- wp:divi/text {"module":{"advanced":{"htmlAttributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"class":"","id":""}}}},"decoration":{"background":{"desktop":{"value":{"color":"#ffffff"}}},"spacing":{"desktop":{"value":{"padding":{"top":"40px","right":"40px","bottom":"0px","left":"40px","syncVertical":"off","syncHorizontal":"on"}}}},"border":{"desktop":{"value":{"radius":{"sync":"on","topLeft":"4px","topRight":"4px","bottomRight":"4px","bottomLeft":"4px"},"styles":{"left":{"width":"5px","color":"#ff8200"}}}}},"boxShadow":{"desktop":{"value":{"style":"preset3","color":"rgba(0,0,0,0.07)"}}},"attributes":{"desktop":{"value":{"attributes":[{"id":"b2f6b5aa-8ab5-437f-899f-56c2b036cdd7","name":"class","value":"pa-toggle-text","adminLabel":"CSS Class"}]}}},"layout":{"desktop":{"value":{"display":"block"}}}}},"content":{"decoration":{"headingFont":{"h3":{"font":{"desktop":{"value":{"weight":"700","style":["uppercase"],"size":"25px"}},"tablet":{"value":{"size":"18px"}},"phone":{"value":{"size":"18px"}}}}}},"innerContent":{"desktop":{"value":"\u003ch3\u003eThe Sabbath Meaning\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe Sabbath meaning, as outlined in the Bible, goes beyond physical restit is a sacred day established by God at Creation to nurture our relationship with Him. Rooted in Genesis and reaffirmed in the Ten Commandments, the Sabbath is a weekly reminder of Gods creative power, love, and redemption. It invites us to pause from lifes busyness, find spiritual renewal, and embrace a divine rhythm of rest, reflection, and worship. To learn more, visit \u0022\u003ca href=\u0022https://www.hopechannel.com/articles/the-bible/the-sabbath/the-sabbath-meaning\u0022 target=\u0022_blank\u0022 rel=\u0022noopener\u0022 title=\u0022The Sabbath Meaning\u0022\u003eThe Sabbath Meaning\u003c/a\u003e\u0022\u003c/p\u003e"}}},"builderVersion":"5.0.0-public-beta.2","themeBuilderArea":{"desktop":{"value":"et_body_layout"}}} /-->
<!-- /wp:divi/column -->
<!-- /wp:divi/row -->

The Life, Death and Resurrection of Christ
